channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2023120126
item.description:
Report E-2023120126

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 30, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2810 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel plugged the damaged drum, then overpacked in one (1) overpack. The crew deployed absorbents and swept them in using hand tools. All UN2810-impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023111107
item.description:
Report X-2023111107

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CONTENTS LEAKED AND WERE DISCOVERED TO BE A HAZMAT. IT THEN WAS PROCESSED AS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT BECAUSE IT HAD NO IDETIFYING MARKS ON THE BOX. DescribePack: CAPS HAD BEEN LOOSE AND THERE WAS ONLY PAPER AS THE PACKAGING DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A BAG

item.title: Report X-2023110820
item.description:
Report X-2023110820

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023110820 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME OFF TRAILER DAMAGED AND WAS PLACED IN A TOTE DescribePack: CONTENTS HAD BEEN CRUSHED AND THEN THEY LEAKED DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN A TOTE. 2. X-2023110821 SequenceEvent: CONTENTS WERE FOUND DAMAGED ON A TRAILER AND THEN WERE PLACED IN A TOTE. DescribePack: CONTENTS WERE CRUSHED AND LEAKED DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN A TOTE. 3. X-2023110822 SequenceEvent: CONTENTS FOUND LEAKING WHEN THEY WERE TAKEN OUT OF TRAILER AND WERE PLACED IN A TOTE DescribePack: NO HAZMAT LABELS AND CONTENTS WERE CRUSHED DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN A TOTE. 4. X-2023110829 SequenceEvent: ARRIVED AT NOKC 732 FROM SDRS 765 902830. PKG ARRIVED DAMAGED AND WET WITH INTERNAL LEAKAGE DUE TO LOOSE CLOSURES, INSUFFICIENT PACKAGING, AND IMPROPER LABELING. DescribePack: LOOSE CLOSURES DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG AND CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN HAZBAG AND HAZ TOTE. 5.X-2023120011 SequenceEvent: CONTENTS FOUND CRUSHED ON TRAILER AND WAS PLACED IN A TOTE. DescribePack: CONTENTS CRUSHED AND HAD BEEN LEAKING DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN A TOTE.
